div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 433 Gephyra, near Thessalonica, Mace- donia, 1965 Burial: late 4th cent. B.C. (T) Contents: 14 AR Philip II: 10 tetradr. Philip III: 1 dr. Boeotia: 1 dr. (2nd cent.) Athens: 2 tetradr. (4th cent.) Disposition: Thessalonica Petsas, A Delt 1966, Chronika, p. 341 The Boeotian drachm is probably an in- trusion
